title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
SQL injection vulnerability in the Multishop extension before 2.0.39 for TYPO3 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary SQL commands via unspecified vectors.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2013-4682
  • http://typo3.org/extensions/repository/view/multishop
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20130701223430/http://typo3.org/teams/security/security-bulletins/typo3-extensions/typo3-ext-sa-2013-009-1
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20200229092533/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/60271
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-v4fw-fh5c-xvjg
items.title: [bvbmedia/multishop] Multishop extension for TYPO3 has SQL Injection vulnerability

items.content_html:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in Basic SEO Features (seo_basics) extension before 0.8.2 for TYPO3 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2012-5888
  • https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/74483
  • http://forge.typo3.org/issues/35532
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20120709063251/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/52772
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20120711210745/http://typo3.org/teams/security/security-bulletins/typo3-extensions/typo3-ext-sa-2012-006
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7p53-8wjr-j8h4
items.title: [b13/seo_basics] Basic SEO Features (seo_basics) extension TYPO3 vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting

items.content_html:
Cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the powermail extension before 1.6.5 for TYPO3 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2012-5889
  • https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/74461
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20120701232300/http://typo3.org/teams/security/security-bulletins/typo3-extensions/typo3-ext-sa-2012-004
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-8cg3-jfjx-3pp2
items.title: [in2code/powermail] powermail extension for TYPO3 has Cross-site Scripting vulnerability

items.content_html:
The Front End User Registration (sr_feuser_register) extension before 2.6.2 for TYPO3 allows remote attackers to obtain user names and passwords via the (1) edit perspective or (2) autologin feature.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2012-5890
  • https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/80145
  • http://forge.typo3.org/projects/extension-sr_feuser_register/repository/entry/trunk/ChangeLog
  • http://forge.typo3.org/projects/extension-sr_feuser_register/repository/revisions/58720
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20120715071728/http://typo3.org/teams/security/security-bulletins/typo3-extensions/typo3-ext-sa-2012-002
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m646-h2pw-56h4
items.title: [sjbr/sr-feuser-register] Front End User Registration (sr_feuser_register) extension for TYPO3 allows remote attackers to obtain user names, passwords

items.content_html:
Eval injection vulnerability in ip_cms/modules/standard/content_management/actions.php in ImpressPages CMS 1.0.12 and possibly other versons before 1.0.13 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via the cm_group parameter.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4932
  • http://seclists.org/bugtraq/2011/Sep/156
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2012/01/15/9
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2012/01/18/12
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20120726055617/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/49798
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20120726081336/http://www.impresspages.org/news/impresspages-1-0-13-security-release
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-fr34-mx6j-vpxh
items.title: [impresspages/impresspages] ImpressPages CMS eval injection vulnerability

items.content_html:
view_help.php in the backend help system in TYPO3 4.5.x before 4.5.19, 4.6.x before 4.6.12 and 4.7.x before 4.7.4 allows remote authenticated backend users to unserialize arbitrary objects and possibly execute arbitrary PHP code via an unspecified parameter, related to a "missing signature (HMAC)."

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2012-3527
  • https://exchange.xforce.ibmcloud.com/vulnerabilities/77791
  • http://www.debian.org/security/2012/dsa-2537
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2012/08/22/8
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20120817233148/http://typo3.org/teams/security/security-bulletins/typo3-core/typo3-core-sa-2012-004
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m4hw-r893-xh4g
items.title: [typo3/cms] TYPO3 allows remote authenticated backend users to unserialize arbitrary objects

items.content_html:
The Command Line Interface (CLI) script in TYPO3 4.4.0 through 4.4.13, 4.5.0 through 4.5.13, 4.6.0 through 4.6.6, 4.7, and 6.0 allows remote attackers to obtain the database name via a direct request.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2012-1607
  • http://www.debian.org/security/2012/dsa-2445
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2012/03/30/4
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20120426034517/http://typo3.org/teams/security/security-bulletins/typo3-core/typo3-core-sa-2012-001
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20120527123559/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/52771
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-q68v-vcjg-r3vp
items.title: [typo3/cms] TYPO3 allows remote attackers to obtain the database name via a direct request

items.content_html:
comment/lib.php in Moodle 2.0.x before 2.0.4 and 2.1.x before 2.1.1 does not properly restrict comment capabilities, which allows remote attackers to post a comment by leveraging the guest role and operating on a front-page activity.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4297
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git;a=commit;h=9da3c2efadcc5f56cb8adc19c67ed16be35780f3
  • http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=182740
  • http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/11/14/1
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git%3Ba=commit%3Bh=9da3c2efadcc5f56cb8adc19c67ed16be35780f3
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-62wv-866c-rh86
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle does not properly restrict comment capabilities

items.content_html:
comment/lib.php in Moodle 2.0.x before 2.0.4 and 2.1.x before 2.1.1 does not properly restrict comment capabilities, which allows remote attackers to post a comment by leveraging the guest role and operating on a front-page activity.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4297

  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-62wv-866c-rh86
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle does not properly restrict comment capabilities

items.content_html:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in the media-filter implementation in filter/mediaplugin/filter.php in Moodle 1.9.x before 1.9.11 and 2.0.x before 2.0.2 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via vectors involving (1) Flash Video (aka FLV) files and (2) YouTube videos.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4286
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git;a=commit;h=8f81bfd412c6b2e93a5b15711727d5cb7cc78336
  • http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=170012
  • http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/11/14/1
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git%3Ba=commit%3Bh=8f81bfd412c6b2e93a5b15711727d5cb7cc78336
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-86v9-gqh9-8268
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting

items.content_html:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in the media-filter implementation in filter/mediaplugin/filter.php in Moodle 1.9.x before 1.9.11 and 2.0.x before 2.0.2 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via vectors involving (1) Flash Video (aka FLV) files and (2) YouTube videos.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4286
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git;a=commit;h=8f81bfd412c6b2e93a5b15711727d5cb7cc78336
  • http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=170012
  • http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/11/14/1
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git%3Ba=commit%3Bh=8f81bfd412c6b2e93a5b15711727d5cb7cc78336
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-86v9-gqh9-8268
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting

items.content_html:
Moodle 2.0.x before 2.0.2 does not use the forceloginforprofiles setting for course-profiles access control, which makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain potentially sensitive information via vectors involving use of a search engine, as demonstrated by the search functionality of Google, Yahoo!, Wrensoft Zoom, MSN, Yandex, and AltaVista.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4279
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git;a=commit;h=81b58cc227cf96a1cd2e002cc210b7b3e376fd17
  • http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=170004
  • http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/11/14/1
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git%3Ba=commit%3Bh=81b58cc227cf96a1cd2e002cc210b7b3e376fd17
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-phqj-xp48-7p7c
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle does not use the forceloginforprofiles setting for course-profiles access control

items.content_html:
Multiple cross-site request forgery (CSRF) vulnerabilities in Moodle 2.0.x before 2.0.2 allow remote attackers to hijack the authentication of arbitrary users for requests that mark the completion of (1) an activity or (2) a course.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4281
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git;a=commit;h=9cedb80c5d6318aa17cd66912d37e6ef3dca9455
  • http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=170006
  • http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/11/14/1
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git%3Ba=commit%3Bh=9cedb80c5d6318aa17cd66912d37e6ef3dca9455
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m97f-x4mr-4x3q
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery

items.content_html:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in the course-tags functionality in tag/coursetags_more.php in Moodle 2.0.x before 2.0.2 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the (1) sort or (2) show parameter.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4282
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git;a=commit;h=73de6fa06f6923278950a445bd69b3fbc1e518d2
  • http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=170008
  • http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/11/14/1
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git%3Ba=commit%3Bh=73de6fa06f6923278950a445bd69b3fbc1e518d2
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-6xqg-f34f-5fjx
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle vulnerable to Cross-site Scripting

items.content_html:
Moodle 2.0.x before 2.0.2 allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information from a myprofile (aka My profile) block by visiting a user-context page.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4284
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git;a=commit;h=0ab727fb35e5ae1d8316d96c6752ee9ebec4c185
  • http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=170010
  • http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/11/14/1
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git%3Ba=commit%3Bh=0ab727fb35e5ae1d8316d96c6752ee9ebec4c185
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mw6p-49jf-9935
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information from myprofile block by visiting user-context page

items.content_html:
admin/uploaduser_form.php in Moodle 2.0.x before 2.0.3 does not force password changes for autosubscribed users, which makes it easier for remote attackers to obtain access by leveraging knowledge of the initial password of a new user.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2011-4287
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git;a=commit;h=22a77963439e00441949440f0517135b3a5418da
  • http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=175588
  • http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2011/11/14/1
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git%3Ba=commit%3Bh=22a77963439e00441949440f0517135b3a5418da
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-j3x5-cwfj-pfcw
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle does not force password changes for autosubscribed users
